Scene: A corridor at a sperm bank.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: That’s the beauty of it.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Well it’s not difficult, you just listen to what she says and then you say something appropriate in response.

Dialogue: Hi.

Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Anyway, um. We brought home Indian food. And, um. I know that moving can be stressful, and I find that when I’m undergoing stress, that good food and company can have a comforting effect. Also, curry is a natural laxative, and I don’t have to tell you that, uh, a clean colon is just one less thing to worry about.

Scene: The stairs of the apartment building.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Leonard, I’m not expert here but I believe in the context of a luncheon invitation, you might want to skip the reference to bowel movements.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Oh, you’re inviting me over to eat?

Dialogue: Uh, yes.

Dialogue: Oh, that’s so nice, I’d love to.

Dialogue: Great.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Okay, well, make yourself at home.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Okay, thankyou.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: You’re very welcome.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: This looks like some serious stuff, Leonard, did you do this?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Actually that’s my work.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Wow.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Yeah, well, it’s just some quantum mechanics, with a little string theory doodling around the edges. That part there, that’s just a joke, it’s a spoof of the Bourne-Oppenheimer approximation.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: So you’re like, one of those, beautiful mind genius guys.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: This is really impressive.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I have a board. If you like boards, this is my board.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Holy smokes.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: If by holy smokes you mean a derivative restatement of the kind of stuff you can find scribbled on the wall of any men’s room at MIT, sure.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Oh, come on. Who hasn’t seen this differential below “here I sit broken hearted?”

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: At least I didn’t have to invent twenty-six dimensions just to make the math come out.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I didn’t invent them, they’re there.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: In what universe?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: In all of them, that is the point.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Uh, do you guys mind if I start?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Um, Penny, that’s where I sit.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: So, sit next to me.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: No, I sit there.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: What’s the difference?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: What’s the difference?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Here we go.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: In the winter that seat is close enough to the radiator to remain warm, and yet not so close as to cause perspiration. In the summer it’s directly in the path of a cross breeze created by open windows there, and there. It faces the television at an angle that is neither direct, thus discouraging conversation, nor so far wide to create a parallax distortion, I could go on, but I think I’ve made my point.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Do you want me to move?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Well.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Just sit somewhere else.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Fine.(Wanders in circles, looking lost.)

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Sheldon, sit!

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Aaah!

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Well this is nice. We don’t have a lot of company over.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: That’s not true. Koothrapali and Wolowitz come over all the time.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Yes I now, but…

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Tuesday night we played Klingon boggle until one in the morning.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Yes, I remember.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I resent you saying we don’t have company.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I’m sorry.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: That is an antisocial implication.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I said I’m sorry.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: So, Klingon boggle?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Yeah, it’s like regular boggle but, in Klingon. That’s probably enough about us, tell us about you.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Um, me, okay, I’m Sagittarius, which probably tells you way more than you need to know.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Yes, it tells us that you participate in the mass cultural delusion that the Sun’s apparent position relative to arbitrarily defined constellations and the time of your birth somehow effects your personality.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Participate in the what?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I think what Sheldon’s trying to say, is that Sagittarius wouldn’t have been our first guess.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Oh, yeah, a lot of people think I’m a water sign. Okay, let’s see, what else, oh, I’m a vegetarian, oh, except for fish, and the occasional steak, I love steak.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: That’s interesting. Leonard can’t process corn.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Wu-uh, do you have some sort of a job?

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Oh, yeah, I’m a waitress at the Cheesecake Factory.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh, okay. I love cheesecake.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: You’re lactose intolerant.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I don’t eat it, I just think it’s a good idea.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Oh, anyways, I’m also writing a screenplay. It’s about this sensitive girl who comes to L.A. from Lincoln Nebraska to be an actress, and winds up a waitress at the Cheesecake Factory.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: So it’s based on your life?

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: No, I’m from Omaha.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Well, if that was a movie I would go see it.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: I know, right? Okay, let’s see, what else? Um, that’s about it. That’s the story of Penny.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Well it sounds wonderful.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: It was. Until I fell in love with a jerk.

Speaker: Sheldon(mouths)
Dialogue: What’s happening.

Speaker: Leonard(mouths back)
Dialogue: I don’t know.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Oh God, you know, four years I lived with him, four years, that’s like as long as High School.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: It took you four years to get through High School?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Don’t.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: I just, I can’t believe I trusted him.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Should I say something? I feel like I should say something.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: You? No, you’ll only make it worse.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: You want to know the most pathetic part? Even though I hate his lying, cheating guts, I still love him. Is that crazy?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No, it’s not crazy it’s, uh, uh, it’s a paradox. And paradoxes are part of nature, think about light. Now if you look at Huygens, light is a wave, as confirmed by the double slit experiments, but then, along comes Albert Einstein and discovers that light behaves like particles too. Well, I didn’t make it worse.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Oh, I’m so sorry, I’m such a mess, and on top of everything else I’m all gross from moving and my stupid shower doesn’t even work.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Our shower works.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Really? Would it be totally weird if I used it?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: No?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: It’s right down the hall.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Thanks. You guys are really sweet.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Well this is an interesting development.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: How so?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: It has been some time since we’ve had a woman take her clothes off in our apartment.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: That’s not true, remember at Thanksgiving my grandmother with Alzheimer’s had that episode.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Point taken. It has been some time since we’ve had a woman take her clothes off after which we didn’t want to rip our eyes out.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: The worst part was watching her carve that turkey.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: So, what exactly are you trying to accomplish here?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: That woman in there’s not going to have sex with you.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Well I’m not trying to have sex with her.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Oh, good. Then you won’t be disappointed.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: What makes you think she wouldn’t have sex with me, I’m a male and she’s a female?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Yes, but not of the same species.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I’m not going to engage in hypotheticals here, I’m just trying to be a good neighbour.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Oh, of course.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: That’s not to say that if a carnal relationship were to develop that I wouldn’t participate. However briefly.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Do you think this possibility will be helped or hindered when she discovers your Luke Skywalker no-more-tears shampoo?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: It’s Darth Vader shampoo.(There is a knock on the door.)Luke Skywalker’s the conditioner.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Wait till you see this.

Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: It’s fantastic. Unbelievable.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: See what?

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: It’s a Stephen Hawking lecture from MIT in 1974.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: This is not a good time.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: It’s before he became a creepy computer voice:.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: That’s great, you guys have to go.

Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: It’s just not a good time.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Leonard has a lady over.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Yeah, right, your grandmother back in town?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No. And she’s not a lady, she’s just a new neighbour.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Hang on, there really is a lady here?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Uh-huh.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: And you want us out because you’re anticipating coitus?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I’m not anticipating coitus.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: So she’s available for coitus?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Can we please stop saying coitus?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Technically that would be coitus interruptus.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Hey, is there a trick to getting it to switch from tub to shower. Oh. Hi, sorry. Hello!

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Enchante Madamoiselle. Howard Wolowitz, Cal-Tech department of Applied Physics. You may be familiar with some of my work, it’s currently orbiting Jupiter’s largest moon taking high-resolution digital photographs.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Penny. I work at the Cheesecake Factory.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Come on, I’ll show you the trick with the shower.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Bon douche.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: I’m sorry?

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: It’s French for good shower. It’s a sentiment I can express in six languages.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Save it for your blog, Howard.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: See-ka-tong-guay-jow.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Uh, there it goes, it sticks, I’m sorry.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Okay. Thanks.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: You’re welcome, oh, you’re going to step right, okay, I’ll….

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Hey, Leonard?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: The hair products are Sheldon’s.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Um, okay. Can I ask you a favour.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: A favour? Sure, you can ask me a favour, I would do you a favour for you.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: It’s okay if you say no.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh, I’ll probably say yes.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: It’s just not the kind of thing you ask a guy you’ve just met.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Wow.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I really think we should examine the chain of causality here.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Must we?

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Event A. A beautiful woman stands naked in our shower. Event B. We drive half way across town to retrieve a television set from the aforementioned woman’s ex-boyfriend. Query, on what plane of existence is there even a semi-rational link between these events?

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: She asked me to do her a favour, Sheldon.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Ah, yes, well that may be the proximal cause of our journey, but we both know it only exists in contradistinction to the higher level distal cause.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Which is?

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: You think with your penis.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: That’s a biological impossibility and you didn’t have to come.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Oh, right, yes, I could have stayed behind and watched Wolowitz try to hit on Penny in Russian, Arabic and Farsi. Why can’t she get her own TV.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Come on, you know how it is with break-ups.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: No I don’t. And neither do you.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Wuh, I, I broke up with Joyce Kim.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: You did not break up with Joyce Kim, she defected to North Korea.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: To mend her broken heart. This situation is much less complicated. There’s some kind of dispute between Penny and her ex-boyfriend as to who gets custody of the TV. She just wanted to avoid having a scene with him.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: So we get to have a scene with him?

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No, Sheldon, there’s not going to be a scene. There’s two of us and one of him.

Scene: Leonard and Sheldon, Inside Leonard’s car
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Leonard, the two of us can’t even carry a TV.

Speaker: Penny(to Raj)
Dialogue: So, you guys work with Leonard and Sheldon at the University?
(Raj looks at her, looks back at his food, takes a mouthful).

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Uh, I’m sorry, do you speak English?

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Oh, he speaks English, he just can’t speak to women.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Really, why?

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: He’s kind of a nerd. Juice box?

Speaker: Leonard(pushes buzzer)
Dialogue: I’ll do the talking.

Speaker: Voice from buzzer
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Hi, I’m Leonard, this is Sheldon.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: What did I just…. Uh, we’re here to pick up Penny’s TV.

Speaker: Voice
Dialogue: Get lost.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Okay, thanks for your time.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: We’re not going to give up just like that.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Leonard, the TV is in the building, we’ve been denied access to the building, ergo we are done.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Excuse me, if I were to give up at the first little hitch I never would have been able to identify the fingerprints of string theory in the aftermath of the big bang.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: My apologies. What’s your plan.
(Leonard starts rattling the doors violently.)

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: It’s just a privilege to watch your mind at work.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Come on, we have a combined IQ of 360, we should be able to figure out how to get into a stupid building.
(Two girl scouts arrive carrying bags of cookies. One runs her hand down the intercom, pushing all the buttons. The door is buzzed open.)

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: What do you think their combined IQ is?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Just grab the door.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: This is it.(Knocks.)I’ll do the talking.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Good thinking, I’ll just be the muscle.

Speaker: Enormous man
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I’m Leonard, this is Sheldon.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: From the intercom.

Speaker: Man
Dialogue: How the hell did you get in the building?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh. We’re scientists.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Tell him about our IQ.

Scene: Outside the apartment building. Leonard and Sheldon exit. They are not wearing trousers.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Leonard.

Scene: Outside the apartment building. Leonard and Sheldon exit. They are not wearing trousers.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: What?

Scene: Outside the apartment building. Leonard and Sheldon exit. They are not wearing trousers.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: My mom bought me those pants.

Scene: Outside the apartment building. Leonard and Sheldon exit. They are not wearing trousers.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I’m sorry.

Scene: Outside the apartment building. Leonard and Sheldon exit. They are not wearing trousers.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: You’re going to have to call her.

Scene: On the stairs of Sheldon and Leonard’s building.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Sheldon, I’m so sorry I dragged you through this.

Scene: On the stairs of Sheldon and Leonard’s building.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: It’s okay. It wasn’t my first pantsing, and it won’t be my last.

Scene: On the stairs of Sheldon and Leonard’s building.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: And you were right about my motives, I was hoping to establish a relationship with Penny that might have some day led to sex.

Scene: On the stairs of Sheldon and Leonard’s building.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Well you got me out of my pants.

Scene: On the stairs of Sheldon and Leonard’s building.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Anyway, I’ve learned my lesson. She’s out of my league, I’m done with her, I’ve got my work, one day I’ll win the Nobel Prize and then I’ll die alone.

Scene: On the stairs of Sheldon and Leonard’s building.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Don’t think like that, you’re not going to die alone.

Scene: On the stairs of Sheldon and Leonard’s building.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Thank you Sheldon, you’re a good friend.

Scene: On the stairs of Sheldon and Leonard’s building.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: And you’re certainly not going to win a Nobel Prize.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: This is one of my favourite places to kick back after a quest, they have a great house ale.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Wow, cool tiger.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Yeah, I’ve had him since level ten. His name is Buttons. Anyway, if you had your own game character we could hang out, maybe go on a quest.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Uh, sounds interesting.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: So you’ll think about it?

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Oh, I don’t think I’ll be able to stop thinking about it.

Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: Smooth.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: We’re home.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Oh, my God, what happened?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Well, your ex-boyfriend sends his regards and I think the rest is fairly self-explanatory.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: I’m so sorry, I really thought if you guys went instead of me he wouldn’t be such an ass.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No, it was a valid hypothesis.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: That was a valid hypothesis? What is happening to you?

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Really, thank you so much for going and trying you’re, uh, you’re so terrific. Why don’t you put some clothes on, I’ll get my purse and dinner is on me, okay?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Really? Great.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Thank you. You’re not done with her, are you?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Our babies will be smart and beautiful.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Not to mention imaginary.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Is Thai food okay with you Penny?

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: We can’t have Thai food, we had Indian for lunch.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: So?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: They’re both curry based cuisines.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: So?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: They would be gastronomically redundant. I can see we’re going to have to spell out everything for this girl.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Any ideas Raj?(He just looks at her with a worried expression.)

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Turn left on Lake Street and head up to Colorado. I know a wonderful little sushi bar that has karaoke.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: That sounds like fun.

Speaker: Howard(sings)
Dialogue: Baby, baby don’t get hooked on me. Uh, baby, baby don’t get hooked on me.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I don’t know what your odds are in the world as a whole, but as far as the population of this car goes, you’re a veritable Mack Daddy.
Written by Chuck Lorre and Bill Prady

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.

Dialogue: But does it have peanut oil?

Dialogue: Are there any chopsticks?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Here we go.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Thailand has had the fork since the latter half of the nineteenth century. Interestingly they don’t actually put the fork in their mouth, they use it to put the food on a spoon which then goes into their mouth.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Ask him for a napkin, I dare you.(There is a knock on the door.)I’ll get it.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Do I look puffy? I feel puffy.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Dialogue: (Leonard opens door to Penny, steps into hallway)

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Hey Leonard.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh, hi Penny.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Am I interrupting.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Sheldon(off)
Dialogue: You’re not swelling, Howard.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Howard(off)
Dialogue: No, no, look at my fingers, they’re like Vienna sausages.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Sounds like you have company.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: They’re not going anywhere.(Closes door, staying in hallway.)So, you’re coming home from work. That’s great. How was work.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Well, you know, it’s the Cheesecake Factory. People order cheesecake, and I bring it to them.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: So, you sort of act as a carbohydrate delivery system.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Yeah, call it whatever you want, I get minimum wage. Yeah, anyways, I was wondering if you could help me out with something, I was….

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Yes.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Oh. Okay, great, I’m having some furniture delivered tomorrow, and I may not be here, so….(apartment door opens, Sheldon, Raj and Howard appear)Oh! Hel…hello!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: (speaks a phrase in Russian).

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: I’m sorry?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Haven’t you ever been told how beautiful you are in flawless Russian?

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: No, I haven’t.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Get used to it.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Hi.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Hey Raj!(Raj looks uncomfortable)Still not talking to me, huh?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Don’t take it personally, it’s his pathology, he can’t talk to women.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: He can’t talk to attractive women, or in your case a cheesecake–scented Goddess!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: So, there’s gonna be some furniture delivered?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, if it gets here and I’m not here tomorrow could you just sign for it and have them put it in my apartment.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Yeah, no problem.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Great, here’s my spare key. Thank you.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Penny, wait.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Yeah?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Um, if you don’t have any other plans, do you want to join us for Thai food and a Superman movie marathon?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: A marathon? Wow, how many Superman movies are there?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: You’re kidding, right?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Yeah, I do like the one where Lois Lane falls from the helicopter and Superman swooshes down and catches her, which one was that?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard,Sheldon and Howard together
Dialogue: One.(Raj raises one finger).

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: You realise that scene was rife with scientific inaccuracy.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Yes, I know, men can’t fly.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Oh no, let’s assume that they can. Lois Lane is falling, accelerating at an initial rate of 32 feet per second per second. Superman swoops down to save her by reaching out two arms of steel. Miss Lane, who is now travelling at approximately 120 miles per hour, hits them, and is immediately sliced into three equal pieces.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Unless, Superman matches her speed and decelerates.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: In what space, sir, in what space? She’s two feet above the ground. Frankly, if he really loved her, he’d let her hit the pavement. It would be a more merciful death.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Excuse me, your entire argument is predicated on the assumption that Superman’s flight is a feat of strength.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Are you listening to yourself, it is well established that Superman’s flight is a feat of strength, it is an extension of his ability to leap tall buildings, an ability he derives from Earth’s yellow Sun.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Yeah, and you don’t have a problem with that, how does he fly at night.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Uh, a combination of the moon’s solar reflection and the energy storage capacity of Kryptonian skin cells.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: I’m just going to go wash up.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I have 26 hundred comic books in there, I challenge you to find a single reference to Kryptonian skin cells.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Challenge accepted.(Tries door.)We’re locked out.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: Also, the pretty girl left.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are present.
Dialogue: Credit sequence.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Okay, her apartment’s on the fourth floor but the elevator’s broken so you’re going to have to(delivery man leaves)oh, you’re just going to be done, okay, cool, thanks. I guess we’ll just bring it up ourselves.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I hardly think so.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Why not?

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Well, we don’t have a dolly, or lifting belts, or any measurable upper body strength.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: We don’t need strength, we’re physicists. We are the intellectual descendents of Archimedes. Give me a fulcrum and a lever and I can move the Earth, it’s just a matter…(starts to move package)I don’t have this… I don’t have this I don’t have this.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Archimedes would be so proud.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Do you have any ideas?

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Yes, but they all involve a green lantern and a power ring.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Dialogue: Time shift, Leonard and Sheldon are now lowering the package onto the bottom of the stairs.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Easy, easy(package falls)Okay! Now we’ve got an inclined plane. The force required to lift is reduced by the sine of the angle of the stairs, call it thirty degrees, so about half.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Exactly half.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Leonard(snarkily)
Dialogue: Exactly half. Let’s push. Okay, see, it’s moving, this is easy, all in the math.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: What’s your formula for the corner.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: What? Oh, okay, uh, okay, yeah, no problem, just come up here and help me pull and turn.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Dialogue: (Sheldon heads up the stairs. The package slides back down to the bottom.)

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Ah, gravity, thou art a heartless bitch.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Dialogue: Time shift, they now have the package on an upstairs hallway, not their own.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: You do understand that our efforts here will in no way increase the odds of you having sexual congress with this woman?

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Men do things for women without expecting sex.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Yeah, those are men who just had sex.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I’m doing this to be a good neighbour. In any case, there’s no way it could lower the odds.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Dialogue: Quick cut to the hallway of their floor, they are nearing the top of the staircase.

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Almost there, almost there, almost there.(Lets go of package, it starts to slip down)

Scene: Ground floor hallway of the apartment building. Leonard is signing for the delivery.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: No we’re not, no we’re not, no we’re not.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Watch your fingers. Watch your fingers. Oh God, my fingers!

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: You okay?

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: No, it hurt…(looking around)Great Caesar’s Ghost, look at this place?

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: So Penny’s a little messy.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: A little messy? The Mandelbrot set of complex numbers is a little messy, this is chaos. Excuse me, explain to me an organisational system where a tray of flatware on a couch is valid. I’m just inferring that this is a couch, because the evidence suggests the coffee table’s having a tiny garage sale.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Did it ever occur to you that not everyone has the compulsive need to sort, organise and label the entire world around them?

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: No.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Well they don’t. Hard as it may be for you to believe, most people don’t sort their breakfast cereal numerically by fibre content.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Excuse me, but I think we’ve both found that helpful at times.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Come on, we should go.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Hang on.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Straightening up.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Sheldon, this is not your home.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: This is not anyone’s home, this is a swirling vortex of entropy.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: When the transvestite lived here, you didn’t care how he kept the place.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Because it was immaculate, I mean, you open that man’s closet, it was left to right, evening gowns, cocktail dresses, then his police uniforms.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: What were you doing in his closet?

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I helped run some cable for a webcam.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Penny(entering)
Dialogue: Hey guys.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh, hey Penny, this just arrived, we just brought this up, just now.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Great. Was it hard getting it up the stairs?

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: (sucks in breath)

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: No?

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: No.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Well, we’ll get out of your hair.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Oh, great, thank you again(she throws her jacket over the back of the sofa).

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Penny, I just want you to know that, you don’t have to live like this. I’m here for you.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: What’s he talking about?

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: It’s a joke.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: I don’t get it.

Scene: Inside Penny’s apartment. They are laying the package down on the floor.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Yeah, he didn’t tell it right.

Scene: Leonard’s bedroom, he is asleep. Sound of door opening and closing somewhere else is heard. Leonard wakes, puts on his glasses and looks at the clock. It is 2:16.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Sheldon?

Scene: The living room. Leonard enters carrying a light sabre.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Sheldon? Hello?

Scene: The living room. Leonard enters carrying a light sabre.
Dialogue: (Notices front door is open, turns off light sabre.)

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Sheldon!

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Sssshhhh! Penny’s sleeping.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Are you insane, you can’t just break into a woman’s apartment in the middle of the night and clean.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I had no choice. I couldn’t sleep knowing that just outside my bedroom was our living room, and just outside our living room was that hallway, and immediately adjacent to that hallway was… this.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Do you realise that if Penny wakes up, there is no reasonable explanation as to why we’re here?

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I just gave you a reasonable explanation.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No, no. You gave me an explanation, it’s reasonableness will be determined by a jury of your peers.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Don’t be ridiculous. I have no peers.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Sheldon, we have to get out of here.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Dialogue: (Penny snores)

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: You might want to speak in a lower register.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: What?

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Evolution has made women sensitive to high pitched noises while they sleep, so that they’ll be roused by a crying baby. If you want to avoid waking her, speak in a lower register.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: That’s ridiculous.(Penny snores again.)

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: No,(lowering his voice dramatically,)that’s ridiculous.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Leonard(doing likewise)
Dialogue: Fine. I accept your premise, now please let’s go.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I am not leaving until I’m done.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: O-o-o-oh!(Collapses against wall).

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: If you have time to lean, you have time to clean.

Scene: Penny’s apartment, penny is sleeping, Sheldon is cleaning. Leonard enters.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh, what the hell.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Morning.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Morning.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I have to say, I slept splendidly. Granted, not long, but just deeply and well.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I’m not surprised. A well known folk cure for insomnia is to break into your neighbour’s apartment and clean.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Sarcasm?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: You think?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Granted, my methods may have been somewhat unorthodox, but I think the end result will be a measurable enhancement of Penny’s quality of life.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: You know what, you’ve convinced me, maybe tonight we should sneak in and shampoo her carpet.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: You don’t think that crosses a line?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Yes! For God’s sake, Sheldon, do I have to hold up a sarcasm sign every time I open my mouth.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: You have a sarcasm sign?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No, I do not have a sarcasm sign.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Do you want some cereal. I’m feeling so good today I’m going to choose from the low fibre end of the shelf. Hello, Honey Puffs.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Penny(voice off)
Dialogue: Son of a Bitch!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Penny’s up.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Penny(voice off)
Dialogue: You sick, geeky bastards!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: How did she know it was us?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I may have left a suggested organisational schematic for her bedroom closet.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Penny(voice off)
Dialogue: Leonard!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: God, this is going to be bad.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Goodbye, Honey Puffs, hello Big Bran.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Penny(entering)
Dialogue: You came into my apartment last night when I was sleeping?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Yes, but, only to clean.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Really more to organise, you’re not actually dirty, per se.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Give me back my key.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I’m very, very sorry.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Do you understand how creepy this is.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh, yes, we discussed it at length last night.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: In my apartment, while I was sleeping.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: And snoring. And that’s probably just a sinus infection, but it could be sleep apnoea, you might want to see an otolaryngologist. It’s a throat doctor.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: And what kind of doctor removes shoes from asses?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Depending on the depth, that’s either a proctologist or a general surgeon.(Leonard holds up a sign reading “Sarcasm”)Oh!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: God!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Okay, look, no Penny, I think what you’re feeling is perfectly valid, and maybe a little bit later today when you’re feeling a little bit less, for lack of a better word, violated, maybe we could talk about this some more.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Stay away from me.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Sure, that’s another way to go.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Penny, Penny, just to clarify because there will be a discussion when you leave, is your objection solely to our presence in the apartment while you were sleeping, or do you also object to the imposition of a new organisational paradigm.(Penny stares in disbelief, then leaves.)Well that was a little non-responsive.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: You are going to march yourself over there right now and apologise.(Sheldon laughs.)What’s funny?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: That wasn’t sarcasm?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Wooh, boy, you are all over the place this morning.(Knocks on Penny’s door.)I have a masters and two PhD’s, I should not have to do this.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Penny(opening door)
Dialogue: What?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room, morning. Sheldon enters, singing to himself.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I am truly sorry for what happened last night, I take full responsibility. And I hope that it won’t colour your opinion of Leonard, who is not only a wonderful guy, but also, I hear, a gentle and thorough lover.(Penny closes door in his face.)I did what I could.

Scene: The stairwell. Raj is coming up the stairs, he meets Penny who is going down.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Hey Raj.(Raj stands looking uncomfortable.)Hey, listen, I don’t know if you heard about what happened last night with Leonard and Sheldon, but I’m really upset about it, I mean they just, they let themselves into my place, and then they cleaned it, I mean can you even believe that? How weird is that?

Scene: The stairwell. Raj is coming up the stairs, he meets Penny who is going down.
Speaker: Raj(internally, while Penny continues to talk)
Dialogue: Ooh, she’s standing very close to me. Oh my, she does smell good. What is that, vanilla?

Scene: The stairwell. Raj is coming up the stairs, he meets Penny who is going down.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: You know, where I come from, someone comes into your house at night, you shoot, okay? And you don’t shoot to wound. I mean, alright, my sister shot her husband, but it was an accident, they were drunk. What was I saying?

Scene: The stairwell. Raj is coming up the stairs, he meets Penny who is going down.
Speaker: Raj(internally)
Dialogue: She’s so chatty. Maybe my parents are right. Maybe I’d be better off with an Indian girl. We’d have the same cultural background, and my wife would sing to my children the same lullabies my mother sang to me.

Scene: The stairwell. Raj is coming up the stairs, he meets Penny who is going down.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: It’s obvious that they meant well, but I’m just, I’m having a really rough time, like I said, I broke up with my boyfriend, and it’s just freaking me out.

Scene: The stairwell. Raj is coming up the stairs, he meets Penny who is going down.
Dialogue: Raj(internally sings an Indian lullaby.)

Scene: The stairwell. Raj is coming up the stairs, he meets Penny who is going down.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: I mean, just because most of the men I’ve known in my life happen to be jerks, doesn’t mean I should just assume Leonard and Sheldon are. Right?

Scene: The stairwell. Raj is coming up the stairs, he meets Penny who is going down.
Speaker: Raj(internally)
Dialogue: She asked me a question. I should probably nod.(Does.)

Scene: The stairwell. Raj is coming up the stairs, he meets Penny who is going down.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: That’s exactly what I thought. Thank you for listening. You’re a doll.(She hugs him.)

Scene: The stairwell. Raj is coming up the stairs, he meets Penny who is going down.
Speaker: Raj(internally)
Dialogue: Oh-oh. Turn your pelvis.(Does.)

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.
Speaker: Howard(jumping off game mat)
Dialogue: Grab a napkin, homie. You just got served.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: It’s fine. You win.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: What’s his problem?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: His imaginary girlfriend broke up with him.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Been there.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.
Speaker: Raj(entering)
Dialogue: Hello. Sorry I’m late. But I was in the hallway, chatting up Penny.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Really? You? Rajesh Koothrapali, spoke to Penny?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.
Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: Actually, I was less the chatter than the chattee.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: What did she say? Is she still mad at me?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.
Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: Well, she was upset at first, but, probably because her sister shot somebody. Then there was something about you and… then she hugged me.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: She hugged you? How did she hug you?(Raj hugs Howard.)Is that her perfume I smell?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.
Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: intoxicating, isn’t it?

Scene: The hallway, Leonard puts a note under Penny’s door. It opens.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Hi.

Scene: The hallway, Leonard puts a note under Penny’s door. It opens.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh.

Scene: The hallway, Leonard puts a note under Penny’s door. It opens.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: What’s going on?

Scene: The hallway, Leonard puts a note under Penny’s door. It opens.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Um, here’s the thing.(Reads from note.)Penny. Just as Oppenheimer came to regret his contributions to the first atomic bomb, so too I regret my participation in what was, at the very least, an error in judgement. The hallmark of the great human experiment is the willingness to recognise one’s mistakes. Some mistakes, such as Madame Curie’s discovery of Radium turned out to have great scientific potential even though she would later die a slow, painful death from radiation poisoning. Another example, from the field of ebola research….

Scene: The hallway, Leonard puts a note under Penny’s door. It opens.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Leonard.

Scene: The hallway, Leonard puts a note under Penny’s door. It opens.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Yeah.

Scene: The hallway, Leonard puts a note under Penny’s door. It opens.
Speaker: Penny(hugs him)
Dialogue: We’re okay.(Kisses him on cheek. Closes door. Leonard looks happy, walks back across hallway and straight into the apartment door.)

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Six two inch dowels.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Check.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: One package, Phillips head screws.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Check.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Guys, seriously, I grew up on a farm, okay, I rebuilt a tractor engine when I was like twelve, I think I can put together a cheap Swedish media centre.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No, please, we insist, it’s the least we can do considering.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Considering what? How great this place looks?

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Howard(across room with Raj)
Dialogue: Oh boy, I was afraid of this.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: What?

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: These instructions are a pictographic representation of the least imaginative way to assemble these components. This right here is why Sweden has no space program.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Well, uh, it looked pretty good in the store.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: It is an inefficient design, for example Penny has a flat screen TV, which means all the space behind it is wasted.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: We could put her stereo back there.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: And control it how?

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Run an infra-red repeater, photocell here, emitter here, easy peasy.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Howard(after Raj whispers in his ear)
Dialogue: Good point, how you gonna cool it?

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Hey guys, I got this.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Hang on Penny. How about fans, here and here?

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Also inefficient, and might be loud.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: How about liquid coolant? Maybe a little aquarium pump here, run some quarter inch PVC…

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Guys, this is actually really simple.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Hold on, honey, men at work. The PVC comes down here, maybe a little corrugated sheet metal as a radiator here.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh, really, show me where we put a drip tray, a sluice and an overflow reservoir?

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: And if water is involved we’re going to have to ground the crap out of the thing.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Guys, it’s hot in here, I think I’ll just take off all my clothes.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh, I’ve got it. How about if we replace panels A, B and F and crossbar H with aircraft grade aluminium.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Right, then the entire thing’s one big heat sink.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Perfect, Leonard, why don’t you and Sheldon go down to the junk yard and pick up about six square metres of scrap aluminium, Raj and I will run down to my lab and get the oxy-acetaline torch.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Meet back here in an hour?

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Done.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Got it.(They all leave).

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Okay, this place does look pretty good.

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Teleplay
Dialogue: Robert Cohen & Dave Goetsch

Scene: Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Speaker: Story
Dialogue: Chuck Lorre & Bill Prady

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Alright, just a few more feet, and…. here we are gentlemen, the Gates of Elzebub.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Good lord!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: Oooh.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Don’t panic, this is what the last 97 hours have been about.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Stay frosty, there’s a horde of armed goblins on the other side of that gate guarding the Sword of Azeroth.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Warriors, unsheathe your weapons, magic wielders raise your wands.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Lock and load.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Raj, blow up the gates.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: Blowing the gates. Control, shift, B! Oh, my God, so many goblins!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Don’t just stand there, slash and move, slash and move.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Stay in formation.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Leonard, you’ve got one on your tail.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: That’s alright, my tail’s prehensile, I’ll swat him off.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: I’ve got him Leonard. Tonight I spice my meat with goblin blood!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Raj, no, it’s a trap, they’re flanking us!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: Oooh, he’s got me.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Sheldon, he’s got Raj, use your sleath spell. Sheldon! Sheldon!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I’ve got the Sword of Azeroth!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Forget the sword, Sheldon, help Raj.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: There is no more Sheldon, I am the Swordmaster!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Leonard look out!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Dammit man, we’re dying here.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Goodbye, peasants.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: The bastard teleported.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: He’s selling the Sword of Azeroth on ebay.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: You betrayed us for money, who are you?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: I’m a rogue knight elf, don’t you people read character descriptions? Wait, wait, wait, somebody just clicked “buy it now.”

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: I am the Swordmaster!

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
Dialogue: Credits sequence

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Wooh, I’m all sweaty, anybody want to log on to second life and go swimming, I just built a virtual pool.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No, I can’t look at you or your avatar right now.
(Sound of female laughter from out in the hall).

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Sounds like your neighbour’s home.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Excuse me.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Don’t forget the mail you took accidentally on purpose so you’d have an excuse to talk to her.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh, right, right right right right.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Stealing snail mail, very old school, I like it.

Speaker: Leonard(exiting to hallway)
Dialogue: Penny, the mailman did it again, he…(looks up to see Penny kissing a hunky man)Oh! Sorry.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Um, no, hi Leonard, this is Doug, Doug, this is my neighbour Leonard.

Speaker: Doug
Dialogue: What’s up bro.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Not much. Bro.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Is, is everything okay.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Uh, yeah, uh, I just, I got your mail again, here.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Thank you, I’ve got to talk to that mailman.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh no, that’s probably not such a good idea. Civil servants have a documented propensity to, you know, snap.

Speaker: Penny
Dialogue: Okay, well, thank you, again.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No problem. Bye. Oh, and, bye, bro!(Returns to apartment).

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Penny for your thoughts.

Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: What’s the matter.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No, I’m fine. Penny’s fine, the guy she’s kissing is really fine and…

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Kissing, what kind of kissing? Cheeks? Lips? Chaste? French?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: What is wrong with you?

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: I’m a romantic.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Please don’t tell me that your hopeless infatuation is devolving into pointless jealousy.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: No, I’m not jealous, I’m just a little concerned for her. I didn’t like the look of the guy that she was with.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Because he looked better than you?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Yeah. He was kinda dreamy.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Well, at least now you can retrieve the black box from the twisted smouldering wreckage that was once your fantasy of dating her, and analyse the data so that you don’t crash into geek mountain again.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: I disagree, love is not a sprint, it’s a marathon. A relentless pursuit that only ends when she falls into your arms. Or hits you with the pepper spray.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Well, I’m done with Penny. I’m going to be more realistic and go after someone my own speed.

Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: Like who?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I don’t know. Olivia Geiger?

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: The dietician at the cafeteria with the limp and the lazy eye?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Well, I don’t think you have a shot there. I have noticed that Lesley Winkle recently started shaving her legs. Now, given that winter is coming one can only assume that she is signalling sexual availability.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: I don’t know, you guys work in the same lab.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: So?

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: There are pitfalls, trust me, I know. When it comes to sexual harassment law I’m… a bit of a self-taught expert.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Look, Howard, if I were to ask Lesley Winkle out it would just be for dinner, I’m not going to walk into the lab, ask her to strip naked and dance for me.

Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Oh, then you’re probably okay.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Hello Lesley.

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: Hi Leonard.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Lesley I would like to propose an experiment.

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: Goggles, Leonard.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Right. Lesley, I would like to propose an experiment.

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: Hang on. I’m trying to see how long it takes a five hundred kilowatt oxygen iodine laser to heat up my cup o’ noodles.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Pfff, I’ve done it, about two seconds, 2.6 for minestrone. Anyway, I was thinking more of a bio-social exploration with a neuro-chemical overlay.

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: Wait, are you asking me out?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I was going to characterise it as the modification of our colleague/friendship paradigm, with the addition of a date-like component. But we don’t need to quibble over terminology.

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: What sort of experiment would you propose?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: There is a generally accepted pattern in this area, I would pick you up, take you to a restaurant, then we would see a movie, probably a romantic comedy featuring the talents of Hugh Grant or Sandra Bullock.

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: Interesting. And would you agree that the primary way we would evaluate either the success or failure of the date would be based on the bio-chemical reaction during the goodnight kiss.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Heartrate, pheromones, etc, yes.

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: Well, why don’t we just stipulate that the date goes well and move to the key variable.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: You mean, kiss you now?

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Can you define the parameters of the kiss?

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: Closed mouth but romantic. Mint?

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Thank you.(Takes mint). Shall I count down from three?

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: No, I think it needs to be spontaneous.
(They kiss.)

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: What do you think.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: You proposed the experiment, I think you should present your findings first.

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: Fair enough. On the plus side, it was a good kiss, reasonable technique, no extraneous spittle. On the other hand, no arousal.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: None?

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: None.

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Ah. Well, thank you for your time.

Speaker: Lesley
Dialogue: Thank you.
(They shake hands. Leonard leaves. Then returns.)

Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: None at all?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Sheldon, if you were a robot, and I knew and you didn’t, would you want me to tell you?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: That depends. When I learn that I’m a robot, will I be able to handle it?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Maybe, although the history of science-fiction is not on your side.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Uh, let me ask you this. When I learn that I’m a robot, would I be bound by Asimov’s three laws of robotics?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: You might be bound by them right now.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: That’s true. Have you ever harmed a human being, or through inaction allowed a human being to come to harm?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Of course not.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Have you ever harmed yourself, or allowed yourself to be harmed except in cases where a human being would have been endangered?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Well, no.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: I smell robot.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Leonard(entering)
Dialogue: Hey, what’s going on.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: The internet’s been down for half an hour.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: Also, Sheldon may be a robot.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: So, how did it go with Lesley?

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: Oh, we tried kissing, but the earth didn’t move. I mean any more than the 383 miles that it was going to move anyway.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Oh, I’ve seen that look before. This is just going to be two weeks of moping and tedious emo songs, and calling me to come down to pet stores to look at cats. I don’t know if I can take it.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Raj
Dialogue: You could power down.

Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
Speaker: Howard
Dialogue: Well, as usual, Wolowitz has the solution. I happen to know a place where there are plenty of eligible women, and Leonard could have his pick.

Scene: A salsa class. The four guys and a random fat bloke salsa opposite five middle-aged women.
Speaker: Class instructor
Dialogue: Remember the Latin hips. Shoulders stay still, and we sway. One two three. Five six seven.

Scene: A salsa class. The four guys and a random fat bloke salsa opposite five middle-aged women.
Speaker: Howard(to Leonard)
Dialogue: I think Mrs Tishman’s got her eye on you. I’ve been there, you’re in for a treat.

Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Oh, good lord.

Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
Speaker: Leonard(singing)
Dialogue: You don’t know me, you don’t wear my chains…God, that’s a good song.

Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: If you’re compiling a mix CD for a double suicide.(Leonard is taking supplies out of a bag)Oh, I hope that scratching post is for you.

Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
Speaker: Leonard
Dialogue: I know what you’re thinking, I’ve taken your asthma into account. There’s a feline geneticist in San Diego who has developed the cutest little hypo-allergenic calicos.

Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
Speaker: Sheldon
Dialogue: Leonard, listen to me…

Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
Speaker: Leonard
